title: Assistant Controller
content:
At NICE, we don’t limit our challenges. We challenge our limits. Constantly. We’re relentless. We’re ambitious. And we make an impact. Our NICErs bring their A game and spend each day turning it into an A+. And if you’re like us, we can offer you the kind of challenge that will light a fire within you.We are looking for an Assistant Controller to assist in the preparation of our financial statements in conformance with all regulatory and accounting guidelines. You will be responsible for ensuring the timely and accurate delivery of our financial statements to our corporate parent.
The Assistant Controller reports directly to the Americas Controller and will assist in the management of the day-to-day accounting and treasury operations across seven legal entities for the Americas region.
The successful candidate must have strong analytical, technology, communication and organizational skills.  In addition, they must be a highly organized, hands on professional with the ability to work in fast paced environment.
Duties and Responsibilities:Monthly Close Support:

Partner with Senior Accountant and offshore team to ensure cash is reconciled as part of the monthly close process
Liaison with Corporate and other regions to ensure monthly intercompany transactions are fully reconciled and prepare/review reconciliation of same
Liaison with FP&A team to ensure their accruals are submitted on time and assist offshore team in ensuring they are recorded properly
Prepare recurring headcount-based accrual entries for benefit related expenses
Prepare bonus accrual entry based on budgeted bonus expense
Assist in the monthly submission of our financial statements using HFM
Prepare quarterly bonus and commission packages for review and submission to Corporate Controller’s team
Manage the preparation of Intercompany Transfer Pricing at the instruction of Corporate Controller’s team
Assist the Americas Controller with quarterly balance sheet review package and tax package preparation and review prior submission to Corporate
Assist the Americas Controller with ad hoc requests

Treasury Management:

Review daily cash position and work with Americas Controller and Corporate Treasury on intercompany funding requests

Other:

Provide support for internal and external audits
Support AP and AR team in resolving offshore team inquires
Assist the Americas Controller with risk management functions such as; certificate of insurance requests and information reporting for the annual business insurance renewal process
Completion of new vendor forms as requested by Sale team and Order Management

Knowledge and Skills:

Highly organized, detailed oriented hands on individual with the ability to multi task
Excellent communication, writing, financial analysis, PC and interpersonal skills.
Intermediate to advanced knowledge of Excel
Experience within an Oracle ERP environment preferred
Experience utilizing Hyperion Financials Management

Education and Experience:

5+ years of experience in Accounting
BA/BS in Accounting or Finance
Active CPA license highly preferred
Proven ability to effectively communicate and influence at all levels of an organization
About NICE 
NICE Ltd. (NASDAQ: NICE) software products are used by 25,000+ global businesses, including 85 of the Fortune 100 corporations, to deliver extraordinary customer experiences, fight financial crime and ensure public safety. Every day, NICE software manages more than 120 million customer interactions and monitors 3+ billion financial transactions. 
Known as an innovation powerhouse that excels in AI, cloud and digital, NICE is consistently recognized as the market leader in its domains, with over 8,500 employees across 30+ countries. 
NICE is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, national origin, age, sex, marital status, ancestry, neurotype, physical or mental disability, veteran status, gender identity, sexual orientation or any other category protected by law.
